body:
Your dockerfile should't try to rebuild the app, look at the dockerfile at the root of this repo for example.

Nevertheless, we can probably improve documentation on that.

actually the [Docker](https://goreleaser.com/docker) section on goreleaser's docs already have a dockerfile example.

Anyway, I made the docs a little bit better.

Oh... so instead of what I had here: https://github.com/unee-t/apienroll/blob/master/Dockerfile ... i use your template: ``` FROM scratch COPY mybin / ENTRYPOINT ["/mybin"] ``` Now I am understanding :sweat_smile:
GitHub
unee-t/apienroll
Contribute to apienroll development by creating an account on GitHub.

Oddly it's not finding my binary in my [test project](http://github.com/kaihendry/lk2)..


```
[hendry@t480s lk2]$ docker run -p 9000:9000 -v /home/hendry/media/out/2018-06-05:/media hendry/lk2
standard_init_linux.go:190: exec user process caused "no such file or directory"

```

yes, now it's a matter of how your app is compiled.

this error seems to be because your app was compiled with CGO enabled, if you want to use scratch as base, you'll need to disable CGO. You can do that adding:

```yaml
build:
  env:
    - CGO_ENABLED=0
```

to your `goreleaser.yml` file `build` section.

Another option is to use another image as base, for example debian or ubuntu...

Shouldn't **CGO_ENABLED=0** be the default if I ask goreleaser to build me an image?

I'm not sure what CGO is & why it's used by default.

no, it shouldn't be default. https://golang.org/cmd/cgo/
cgo - The Go Programming Language

If it's not enabled by default, why do I need to specify that in my https://github.com/kaihendry/lk2/blob/master/goreleaser.yml env ?
GitHub
kaihendry/lk2
lk2 - Tool to help prune the photos and videos you no longer want

it is enabled by default in the Go compiler, so it is enabled by default on goreleaser as well.

`CGO_ENABLED=0` disables it, actually.

issue.title: goreleaser without build step
issue.body:
This might be a stupid question, but is it possible to use goreleaser without the build step? 

I've stumbled accross this project, as I have multiple projects for which I want to create a new release on a regular basis. Most of the projects are dockerized - i.e there exists a `Dockerfile` which contains all the necessary dependencies and compiles the go application during the build step. 

As everything is already done within the Dockerfile, I do not need an additional build step. So what I would need is just the "release functionality" of goreleaser. 

Everything I tried to so far ended in an error similar to this one here: https://github.com/goreleaser/goreleaser/issues/694

Is that somehow possible to accomplish?

body: This issue has been automatically locked since there has not been any recent activity after it was closed. Please open a new issue for related bugs.
